channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Big AI models will be commoditized — the value will come from the applications, Infosys chair says
item.description: Nandan Nilekani, co-founder of Infosys, said there are going to many different large language models around the world.

item.title: European stocks higher with central bank decisions in focus; Commerzbank shares hit 12-year high
item.description: European stocks were higher Tuesday, as upcoming central bank meetings remain in focus.

item.title: Fed to cut rates by a quarter point with a soft landing expected, according to CNBC Fed Survey
item.description: The survey shows 84% of the 27 respondents, including economists, fund managers and strategists, see the Fed cutting by a quarter percentage point.

item.title: China's ultra-rich population sees 'dramatic' growth in last 10 years, outpacing the U.S., report shows
item.description: The world's super rich club saw a significant expansion over the past 10 years, with China leading the charge, a report by Henley & Partners showed.

item.title: British e-commerce firm THG plans to spin off technology services arm, shares tumble
item.description: THG said it is "actively undertaking detailed work to review potential structures to facilitate the demerger of THG Ingenuity."

item.title: Big names like David Tepper and 'Big Short' investor Michael Burry are quietly upping their bets on the Chinese economy
item.description: From property woes to sluggish economic data, China appears to be suffering from long Covid.

item.title: Amazon tells employees to return to office five days a week
item.description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy is instructing corporate staffers to work out of the office five days a week.

item.title: China seeks a homegrown alternative to Nvidia — these are some of the companies to watch
item.description: Some of China's giants inclduing Huawei, Alibaba and Baidu are among those trying to create alternative semiconductor tech to Nvidia.

item.title: This 38-year-old is financially independent with passive income. Here's how he built a 7-figure real estate portfolio
item.description: Shu Matsuo Post, 38, has reached financial independence after building a seven-figure real estate portfolio. Today, he lives in Japan with his wife and kids.

item.title: FDA clears Apple's sleep apnea detection feature for use. Here's how it works
item.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Monday cleared Apple's new sleep apnea detection feature for use.

item.title: India's central bank chief plays down fears of a deposit crunch
item.description: Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das raised the issue of slowing bank deposits underperforming an expansion in loans in an interview with CNBC.

item.title: A push toward sustainable jet fuel is leaving investors with unanswered questions
item.description: "The truth is, it's going to be more expensive, you can't really sugarcoat that," one producer said.

item.title: The Bank of Japan's next rate hike may come in December, not this week: CNBC survey
item.description: CNBC surveyed economists, FX strategists and Japan-focused fund managers on their BOJ expectations and year-end forecast for the yen.

item.title: New details of Trump family crypto project released, including who can buy in
item.description: World Liberty Financial is expected to operate as a crypto banking platform.

item.title: China's economy is going through a 'slow, painful, grinding adjustment,' analyst says
item.description: Beijing's economic outlook for the second half of the year is now "flashing red, or pretty close to red," said Eswar Prasad, professor of international trade and economics at Cornell University.

item.title: Biden administration awards Intel up to $3 billion under the CHIPS Act
item.description: The Biden administration announced Monday that it is awarding Intel up to an additional $3 billion under the CHIPS Act.

item.title: In federal trial, Michael Kors says it's harder to sell handbags in TikTok and Taylor Swift era
item.description: It is one of the latest testimonies in the Federal Trade Commission's lawsuit to block the merger of Coach's owner Tapestry and Michael Kors' owner Capri.

item.title: Apple shares slide as analysts highlight sluggish iPhone 16 demand
item.description: Apple shares slid on Monday, after reports that demand for the new iPhone 16 is lower than expected.

item.title: Apple releases iOS 18 for iPhones, but it doesn't include Apple Intelligence
item.description: This is Apple's biggest iPhone update of the year, but this one does not include Apple Intelligence, the company's forthcoming artificial intelligence system.

item.title: Suspect in apparent Trump assassination attempt charged with two gun crimes, appears in court
item.description: Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump narrowly survived a prior assassination attempt at a campaign rally two months earlier.

item.title: Boeing freezes hiring in sweeping cost cuts as it grapples with factory worker strike
item.description: Boeing also said it will pause nonessential staff travel and reduce supplier spending as it deals with a strike by more than 30,000 factory workers.

item.title: Intel stock jumps on plan to turn foundry business into subsidiary and allow for outside funding
item.description: Intel said it's turning its foundry business into an independent unit with its own board and the potential to raise outside capital.

item.title: Drugmakers bet billions that targeted radiation could become the next cancer breakthrough
item.description: Bristol Myers Squibb, AstraZeneca, Eli Lilly and other drug companies have invested some $10 billion on promising cancer technology behind Novartis' Pluvicto.

item.title: It's a big week for central banks around the world, with a slew of rate moves on the table
item.description: The Federal Reserve's highly anticipated two-day meeting, which gets underway on Tuesday, is poised to take center stage.

item.title: Apple iOS 18 update is live: These are the most important new iPhone security features to protect your private life
item.description: Apple iOS 18 released Monday and while iPhone 16 received most of the recent attention, it is one of the most significant updates for user privacy and security.

item.title: India can achieve sustainable growth of up to 8% in the coming years, central bank chief says
item.description: India can achieve sustainable economic growth of up to 8% over the medium term, according to the country's central bank governor.

item.title: The Fed has the proof it wants that inflation is slowing, but the next move is still up in the air
item.description: A week's worth of inflation data showed that price pressures have eased substantially.

item.title: China's local government debt problems are a hidden drag on economic growth
item.description: China's persistent consumption slowdown traces back to the country's real estate slump, and its deep ties to local government finances — and debt.

item.title: Pfizer says its experimental drug for deadly condition that causes appetite and weight loss in cancer patients shows positive trial results
item.description: The results could pave the way for Pfizer's drug ponsegromab to become the first-ever approved treatment specifically for cancer cachexia.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: After the Fed’s first cut, where to next?
item.description: What many are not discussing is the policy trajectory after the Fed's meeting. Following this cut could be a trajectory that will change the market narrative.
